task.title: Capturing and Viewing a Snapshot
task.shortdesc: You can capture a snapshot of data as it passes through the pipeline. You can capture up to ten snapshots. You can review the snapshot data stage by stage or through a group of stages, like data preview. You can also delete snapshot data.

context.p: snapshotoverviewView a snapshot of data to verify how the pipeline processes data. In the Monitor panel, you can drill down to review the values of each record to determine if the stage or group of stages transform data as expected.

step.cmd: From the pipeline canvas of a running pipeline, click the Snapshots icon.
In the Snapshots dialog box, optionally click Capture Snapshot to capture a new set of data.
Click View for the snapshot of data that you want to use.
step.stepresult: The canvas highlights the origin stage of the pipeline. The Monitor panel displays snapshot data in the Output Data column. Since this is the origin of the pipeline, no input data displays.

step.cmd: To view the snapshot for multiple stages, click Multiple.
step.info:
The Preview panel displays two lists of stages:
From the list on the left, select the first stage to include.
In the list on the right, select the last stage to include.

step.cmd: To review data from a different snapshot, on the upper left side of the monitor panel, select a different snapshot name
To exit the snapshot review, click Close Snapshot.
